data.headline: Dow fell 0.45%, S&P 500 slipped 0.04%, and Nasdaq lost 0.25% near midday as early gains reversed
bullets: Russell 2000 underperformed, dropping between 1.16% and 1.50% amid broad small-cap weakness
Stronger-than-expected January jobs report pushed Treasury yields higher and reduced odds of near-term Fed rate cuts
Growth stocks and small caps faced outsized selling as traders rotated out of tech, software, and AI names
Mattel, Lyft, Robinhood, Unity, Moderna, and Kraft Heinz all posted sharp post-earnings declines
Select AI and crypto-linked stocks, along with Cloudflare, bucked the trend and rallied
Traders focused on Treasury market moves, deficit concerns, and signals that the Fed may hold rates steady through May
